'Christopher Fulford' (born 1955 in London) is a British actor who is best known
for his supporting roles in many British TV shows.

In his early career he often appeared in British crime dramas. He was guest
star of both the ITV crime series [[Inspector Morse]], in "Driven to
Distraction" (1990) http://epguides.com/inspectormorse/guide.shtml
and as a killer in the early [[A Touch of Frost]] episode "Widows and Orphans"
(1994). http://epguides.com/touchoffrost/guide.shtml In 1993,
Fulford also starred in the BBC adaptation of [[Scarlet and Black (TV
Series)|Scarlet and Black]] alongside a virtually unknown Ewan McGregor and
Rachel Weisz. He also appeared as a "male vigilante" in [[Dalziel and Pascoe
(BBC TV series)|Dalziel & Pascoe]] and a corrupt footballer in [[The Fix (TV
film)|The Fix]].

He has featured as the murderer in the Hollywood film [[D-Tox]] (2002, with
Sylvester Stallone), and also appeared in [[Millions]] (2004) and [[Pierrepoint
(film)|Pierrepoint]] (2005) and the television dramas [[The Last Train (TV
series)|The Last Train]] and [[Deceit (TV serial)|Deceit]]. He has also appeared
extensively on British television, appearing in guest roles in many episodes of
series such as [[Inspector Morse (TV series)|Inspector Morse]], [[Cracker (UK TV
series)|Cracker]], [[Prime Suspect (UK TV series)|Prime Suspect]], [[Dalziel and
Pascoe (BBC TV series)|Dalziel and Pascoe]], [[Murphy's Law]] (fifth series),
[[Wire in the Blood]] (episode "Right to Silence"), [[Spooks]], [[Judge John
Deed]], [[Waking the Dead (TV series)|Waking the Dead]] and [[The Brief
(ITV)|The Brief]]. He recently appeared in the ITV1 dramas [[Whitechapel (TV
series)|Whitechapel]] and [[Collision (TV series)|Collision]], both alongside
Phil Davis. He also played a suicidal Prime Minister in the British TV-series
[[The Last Enemy (TV series)|The Last Enemy]].

Christopher married actress Camille Coduri in 1992. They have two children, Rosa
(born 1993) and Santino (born 1996). {{cite news |first = Jon |last = Wise
